name: cockroach
description: A Pulumi package to create and managed cockroach db resources in Pulumi programs.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`cockroach` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package to create and managed cockroach db resources in Pulumi programs.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-cockroach` repo](https://github.com/lbrlabs/pulumi-cockroach/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-cockroach` repo](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach/issues).

privateNetworkVisibility.description: Set to true to assign private IP addresses to nodes. Required for CMEK and other advanced networking features.

primary.description: Set to true to mark this region as the primary for a Serverless cluster. Exactly one region must be primary. Dedicated clusters expect to have no primary region.
Set to true to mark this region as the primary for a Serverless cluster. Exactly one region must be primary. Dedicated clusters expect to have no primary region.

status.description: Aggregated status of the cluster's encryption key(s)
Aggregated status of the cluster's encryption key(s)

channels.description: A list of CRDB log channels to include in this group

logName.description: The name of the group, reflected in the log sink

minLevel.description: The minimum log level to filter to this log group

redact.description: Governs whether this log group should aggregate redacted logs if unset

provider.description:
The provider type for the cockroach package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

cockroach:index/cmek:Cmek.description: Customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) resource for a single cluster

additionalRegions.description: Once CMEK is enabled for a cluster, no new regions can be added to the cluster resource, since they need encryption key info stored in the CMEK resource. New regions can be added and maintained here instead.

authPrincipal.description: Either the AWS Role ARN that identifies a role that the cluster account can assume to write to CloudWatch or the GCP Project ID that the cluster service account has permissions to write to for cloud logging

logName.description: An identifier for the logs in the customer's log sink

redact.description: Controls whether logs are redacted before forwarding to customer sinks

region.description: Controls whether all logs are sent to a specific region in the customer sink

type.description: The cloud selection that we're exporting to along with the cloud logging platform. Possible values are `GCP_CLOUD_LOGGING` or `AWS_CLOUDWATCH`

cockroach:index/maintenanceWindow:Mainte.description: Maintenance window resource for a cluster.

offsetDuration.description: The offset duration is the duration in seconds from the beginning of each Monday (UTC) after which the maintenance window starts.

windowDuration.description: The window duration is the duration in seconds that the maintenance window will remain active for after it starts.

password.description:
If provided, this field sets the password of the SQL user when created. If omitted, a random password is generated, but
not saved to Terraform state. The password must be changed via the CockroachDB cloud console.

If provided, this field sets the password of the SQL user when created. If omitted, a random password is generated, but
not saved to Terraform state. The password must be changed via the CockroachDB cloud console.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering SqlUser resources.

password.description:
If provided, this field sets the password of the SQL user when created. If omitted, a random password is generated, but
not saved to Terraform state. The password must be changed via the CockroachDB cloud console.

cockroach:index/getClusterCert:getCluste.description:
TLS certificate for the specified CockroachDB cluster. Certificates for dedicated clusters should be written to `$HOME/Library/CockroachCloud/certs/<cluster name>-ca.crt` on MacOS or Linux, or `$env:appdata\CockroachCloud\certs\<cluster name>-ca.crt` on Windows. 

Serverless clusters use the root PostgreSQL CA cert. If it isn't already installed, the certificate can be appended to `$HOME/.postgresql/root.crt` on MacOS or Linux, or `$env:appdata\postgresql\root.crt` on Windows.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getClusterCert.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getClusterCert.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCockroachCluster.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCockroachCluster.

cockroach:index/getConnectionString:getC.description: Generic connection string for a given cluster

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getConnectionString.

database.description: Database to connect to. Defaults to 'defaultdb'.

password.description: Database user password. Must also include `sql_user`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getConnectionString.

connectionParams.description: List of individual connection string parameters. Can be used to build nonstandard connection strings.

connectionString.description: Fully formatted connection string. Assumes the cluster certificate is stored in the default location.

database.description: Database to connect to. Defaults to 'defaultdb'.

password.description: Database user password. Must also include `sql_user`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getOrganization.

email.description: Email address used to find the User ID.
